comment: The lectures are heavy, and they will randomly ask questions of the class that they don't understand, and will make you seem stupid for knowing. But the labs are easy and can be re-taken for the best grade possible. Tests are somewhat difficult, but can be outweighed if you do online discussions. It can be a little hard to understand sometimes.

Do not take his class! His lectures are close to useless as he docent necessarily go over the content you need to know. He quit taking attendance halfway through the semester and you can do the work at home but even then the lab doesn't match with the corresponding quiz. He is hard to email since he doesn't reply until you follow up 2-3 times later

Dr. Anilkumar Gangadharan has a deep knowledge of the subjects that he teaches. However, his teaching styles and policies do not translate into effective learning by his students. Most lectures consist of incomprehensible word vomit and his passive-aggressive attitude does not help engage the learner. He also misleads his students for fun.

I will say that there are very little assignments for his class. You will not understand a word he says. You can ask a question, and he will never give a direct answer. Every two weeks you have a lab that takes a couple hours if you can't find a quizlet, and you have unlimited attempts but the actual answering parts on D2l are impossible.

He has a thick accent and is very hard to understand but if you can get past that his class is super easy. It is graded by 7 very easy labs, 4 discussion posts, and 2 tests which are both easy. If you don't want to do much work and are just taking it for gen ed I would recommend taking this class but if you actually want to learn don't take it.

Very hard to understand in class, which isn't that serious but he makes you feel kind of stupid for not knowing things when you really just can't understand him. Not very organized and no good ways to take notes or study. Class was pretty easy though and it's not hard to make an A. Attendance is mandatory only on random days.

Coursework is easy but he has a thick accent so he can be hard to understand. Additionally, his lectures are not structured and many days I left with more questions than I walked in with. I stopped going to class after the midterm. I would not take this class again if I didn't have to.

I would not recommend this class! The work really is not hard, the labs are easy. He is SO HARD TO UNDERSTAND and he does not care if you understand him. He makes students feel stupid for asking questions. You can't really take notes because he is kind of all over the place. He takes attendance randomly for a grade.

Please do not take this teacher if you can avoid it. He does not make sure his students understand the information. He makes people feel bad for answering questions wrong in class and even sometimes deducts points from their lab if they answer a question wrong in class. He takes attendance randomly. There is also lab's every two weeks. DO NOT TAKE!

If you want to do in person and are looking for an easy A take this class. He assigns a lot of labs and discussions but gives a lot of materials and time to do them. Although if you're confused he is no help, he would go off topic so many times in class and he is quite hard to understand.
He has a very strong accent that makes it difficult to understand. The work is pretty easy, some labs and discussion posts.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: At first, I struggled with his class, but it got better. Attendance isn't mandatory but I would recommend going so you don't have to read everything in the textbook. There are 3 discussion posts, 8 labs, and a midterm and final. The labs can be difficult, and he has an odd way of wording things. 95+ is exempt from the final and no lockdown browser.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Accessible outside class

comment: Super easy class, he posts his work week by week and you can find it all online. There are 3 discussion posts, a few labs, a midterm, and a final. Gives good feedback when you get anything wrong.

Gives you nothing to study for exams & the online labs are unnecessarily hard. Changed due dates multiple times due to lack of communication. Doesn't try to help you understand material & never gave clear instructions for homework in class. 90% of my class failed or almost failed the first test (there are only 2 tests + final) I learned nothing.

I did not want to leave another bad review because I felt like everything has already been said, but let me just add this: he never gave us a single study guide before the exams and he does not respond to emails in a timely manner. Not a bad guy, just too unorganized. Does not use lockdown browser though.

Unironically the worst professor I have ever had, not only is he arrogant and rude, but extremely hard to understand due to his thick accent (not his fault I understand) and his confusing way of stringing sentences together that leaves your brain working at maximum capacity to try and figure out what he is trying to get across. He insults students.

Don't recommend his class. He is very unprepared and it looks like he doesn't know the material he is teaching. He constantly changes his answers. We would constantly find error in the assignment and practice test. He has a thick accent so its a bit hard to understand him. It's an easy class and easy material but its mostly self taught
Please never take this professor. You will not be able to understand what he is saying and he changes what he says from day to day. Very confusing, but easy material.
Hes a nice guy but his lectures are very long and always go over class time by 15+ minutes. The tests are easy and there is very minimal homework.

Took this professor during COVID* At first this was a hybrid course that later become fully online. He has a heavy accent, didnt really retain anything. Three test (no final) and the rest were labs. Im not sure if he even took attendance. I did come out with a B, surprisingly. He curved my grade TREMENDOUSLY, so shoutout to him.
Everything from this teacher is on quizlet, yet they still get the correct answers wrong and have to regrade things. Half-assed teacher that does not work with you when you need help.

definitely take him for weather & climate!! he doesn't use lockdown browser, only 3 tests. labs due every other week, but they are not hard or time consuming at all. i'm terrible at science and ended with a 91!! can't recommend him enough!

Please take his class online. He is SO lenient with due dates, NONE of his exams are Lockdown Browser, and the material is ridiculously easy. He also responds to emails really quickly, and lets you retake anything! He also is NOT a harsh grader at all. I am so shocked his RMP reviews are so low... Glad I took him over the Summer, easiest A ever!

There are weekly assignments & 3 test. I used the textbook once & was able to find everything online. Allows late work if you email him. I was able to turn in an assignment that was 2 months overdue & I still made a 70 on that assignment. Everyone should have no reason not to pass his class. Overall pretty easy course, take him you wont regret it.

Not sure why this professor has a low rating! So much of his content is found online. He is a very fair grader and he gives you the correct answers after you submit. I couldn't pass one of the quizzes at the end to move forward and he accepted my highest attempt instead of giving me the 0 for not getting at least a 70. Give him a chance!

The only reason this class was easy is because the only assignments were the weekly online labs . He randomly passes a sheet around for attendance so I'd go but lectures are pointless. He's impossible to understand and was is very rude. The only good thing is that you can find the answers to the labs and tests (which are on D2L) online.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Gangadharan isn't a bad professor, but beware of his class if you end up taking it. It is not an easy A, nor is it even an easy B. I took his online class and the tests were always extremely difficult. I barely slid into an A at the end of the semester. Highly recommend that those who take him get a subscription for Chegg or CourseHero.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Poor communication skills with students, disrespectfully unaware of students, and difficult to access outside of class. If you are looking to be a meteorologist then maybe keep looking, you might have a better time learning from the weather app than this. If you are looking to learn about the weather I'd suggest just looking out the window instead.

I honestly didnt go to class very much. I couldnt understand what he was saying and his lectures were very hard to follow. Besides that , he was a very nice professor and allowed me to make up an extra credit assignment I had missed so that I could get an A in his class. Assignments and labs are fairly easy and he is very fair in his grading.

He seems sweet and is passionate about science, but I can't understand a word of what he says. He's pretty monotone too, making the class very dull to listen too. There were a decent amount of labs and all the classes are online along with the powerpoints, so if you're good at teaching yourself the content then it's an easy class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: He's a nice guy, but he is so hard to understand. Most of the time he just says, "if you want to know the answer just google it...". His class is pretty easy though since the labs and tests are online!

The easiest science class I've taken. He is super easy, and chill. The class consists of 7 labs, 2 tests, and attendance grade. You could basically fail the test and still pass the class. But don't do that it's super easy!

One of the easier classes I have taken. I took it online so accent was not a variable. There were a few projects in this class, but they are super easy (take a picture of various clouds and describe what kind they are)
He is teaching about climate and weather conditions, he is very smart and easy to talk to. There is no reason you should do bad in his class if you're a good student.

Absolutely awful, he told the students to stop emailing him and leave him alone. He does not work with the students to help and is really bad at communicating. You cannot understand anything he says and his test are extremely hard even if you use your textbook. absolutely do not recommend

Not sure what we did to earn his fury but he insulted the class very frequently. Just disrespectful at best, and unprofessional insults. The tests are very very difficult. A lot of the coursework is taken directly out of the text book, you will not pass without it. Even then, dont expect an A.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Seriously cares about students and is extremely knowledgeable in the courses he teaches. His ascent isnt really that bad as some make him out to be. I'd recommend to take his hybrid class- all test are online and he gives a study guide.

The professor is really nice and will try to do everything he can to help you, however he is very hard to understand. His assignments are easy, but the tests are quite difficult. They were open book and online and I still struggled.

The class was easy. You must study though and read the material a few times to get a A. I took the class online so there was never any communication issues. I think there was confusion whith what to do on one assignment, but overall the class was not stressful at all.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Tests are tough

comment: Well, he isn't a bad professor per se, but he isn't that great either. First, his lectures are dry, but he tries to spice things up sometimes. Second, he can be rather emotionally volatile/intimidating at times. And, lastly, he has a certain foreign accent that makes him a tad hard to understand at times. Beyond all of that he is... okay, I guess.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: DANGER! DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS FROM THIS TEACHER!
It's super hard to understand him because of his accent. The class is very boring and dull. Don't take this class unless you have to.

If you don't like to sit near the front, you probably won't want to take him simply based on his accent. He's a great guy and a good teacher, but words get lost to his Indian accent. English isn't his first language either, so sometimes he can get confused, but corrects himself.
Took online 4 week summer class.  Enjoyed it much more than expected.  Professor provided great feedback and support.  Absolutely would take again.  Very fair grader and helpful when needed.

Easy A/B course. He is very easy and all of the work is online. Grade consists of easy labs and three exams. He responds fast via email and is very flexible. I ended up with a 97.9% in the class. Buy the book cause you need it for the exams. I would say the only difficult thing is that the exams are a little challenging. Other than that, EASY A!

Maybe I just had the semester where he has gotten tired of people failing and has thus made it an easy course to pass or it just wasn't difficult for me but this honestly could have been my easiest A. Most everything is done online, so i don't know why he has class. kind of unclear at time but overall an ok teacher.

I thought this class would be interesting,, but it is taughtt like an upper level course.  Very intense with lots of reading and labs.  Difficult for the ccourse level.  Very time consuming.  Take with a small load of classes.
omg that class make me annoying. pronunciations are very unclear and not organize
Nice guy but he's confusing, test are done online and come out to be difficult. Don't expect to get your grade rounded up.. he's very hard to convince.

He knows what he is talking about really good. But his problem is how unclear he is on assignments. One day he will say its due at midnight, the next day he will be like its due during class or before. When you confront him about the misunderstanding, he simplify will blame it on you, by saying you should have known when its due.

Very confusing professor and class is definitely stressful at times (but manageable). Told all of us to use google for our tests (open book), but his test questions are far from easy (not from the book or lectures). Very soft voice and strong Indian accent, but he is nice and wants all of us to do well. However, would NOT take his class again.

Indian teacher with strong accent. Can make understanding kind of hard. Very nice man and understanding. Easy labs and all  online tests. 1 easy end of course presentation. He wants all students to get at least a B if they show ANY effort. Loves his subject. Talk to him and you'll do fine in his class.
